description: In this course, we will examine the social and political history of the Islamic Near East in its formative centuries. It covers such topics as the of Islam; the early Islamic conquests; the expansion and disintegration of the imperial caliphate under the Umayyads and 'Abbasids; religious authority in early Islam; 'Abbasid successor states; Shi'ism; and provincial cultures. This course requires basic prior knowledge of Islam and the Near East, such as prior enrollment in NELC 102 or equivalent. Note that undergraduates must register for the course as NELC 337; graduate students must register for the as NELC 637. Undergraduates are not permitted to register under the graduate number.
name: AGE OF CALIPHS, 600-1100
